Usage: mulder-specs [options] [command]

Tooling to manage project specifications for agentic projects

Options:
  -V, --version       output the version number
  -h, --help          display help for command

Commands:
  init [options]      Create new specification with auto-detected project
                      context
  update [options]    Update progress by scanning codebase and updating spec
                      checkboxes
  status [options]    View current implementation status (MVP progress by
                      default)
  validate [options]  Validate project against specification (enforces
                      MVP-first by default)
  report [options]    Generate compliance report formatted by implementation
                      phases
  help [command]      display help for command


One-Click Philosophy:
  Commands use sensible defaults and auto-detect context from your project.

  ‚Ä¢ Specification files are auto-discovered (SPEC.md, SPEC-*.md)
  ‚Ä¢ Project context is inferred from package.json, README, and codebase
  ‚Ä¢ MVP-first enforcement prevents premature advanced feature implementation
  ‚Ä¢ Minimal arguments required - the tool "just works"

Examples:
  $ mulder-specs init              # Create spec with auto-detected project info
  $ mulder-specs update            # Scan code and update progress automatically
  $ mulder-specs status            # Show MVP completion status
  $ mulder-specs validate          # Validate with MVP enforcement
  $ mulder-specs report            # Generate phase-based progress report
```

   261‚Üí  /**
   262‚Üí   * Parse custom mode data from raw bytes
   263‚Üí   * Updated to handle Launch Control XL 3 format (not Midimunge)
   264‚Üí   * Note: Device uses 0x48 in READ responses, 0x49 in WRITE commands
   265‚Üí   */
   266‚Üí  private static parseCustomModeData(data: number[]): {
   267‚Üí    controls: ControlMapping[];
   268‚Üí    colors: ColorMapping[];
   269‚Üí    name?: string;
   270‚Üí  } {
   271‚Üí    const controls: ControlMapping[] = [];
   272‚Üí    const colors: ColorMapping[] = [];
   273‚Üí    let modeName: string | undefined;
   274‚Üí
   275‚Üí    // Parse mode name - look for ASCII after header pattern
   276‚Üí    let nameStart = -1;
   277‚Üí    let nameEnd = -1;
   278‚Üí
   279‚Üí    // Look for the 0x06 0x20 0x08 or 0x00 0x20 0x08 header pattern first
   280‚Üí    for (let i = 0; i < data.length - 3; i++) {
   281‚Üí      if ((data[i] === 0x06 || data[i] === 0x00) && data[i + 1] === 0x20 && data[i + 2] === 0x08) {
   282‚Üí        nameStart = i + 3;
   283‚Üí        break;
   284‚Üí      }
   285‚Üí    }
   286‚Üí
   287‚Üí    if (nameStart > 0) {
   288‚Üí      const nameBytes = [];
   289‚Üí      for (let i = nameStart; i < data.length - 1; i++) {
   290‚Üí        // FIXED: Stop at explicit terminator 0x21 0x00 first
   291‚Üí        if (data[i] === 0x21 && data[i + 1] === 0x00) {
   292‚Üí          nameEnd = i;
   293‚Üí          break;
   294‚Üí        }
   295‚Üí
   296‚Üí        // Only break on control marker if we haven't found a name terminator
   297‚Üí        // and we're at least 8 bytes past the start (max mode name length)
   298‚Üí        if (data[i] === 0x48 && i >= nameStart + 8) {
   299‚Üí          // Double-check this is actually a control marker by validating structure
   300‚Üí          if (i + 9 < data.length &&
   301‚Üí              data[i + 2] === 0x02 && // Definition type
   302‚Üí              data[i + 1] !== undefined && data[i + 1]! <= 0x3F) {  // Valid control ID range
   303‚Üí            nameEnd = i;
   304‚Üí            break;
   305‚Üí          }
   306‚Üí        }
   307‚Üí
   308‚Üí        const byte = data[i];
   309‚Üí        if (byte !== undefined && byte >= 32 && byte <= 126) { // Printable ASCII
   310‚Üí          nameBytes.push(byte);
   311‚Üí        }
   312‚Üí      }
   313‚Üí
   314‚Üí      if (nameBytes.length > 0) {
   315‚Üí        modeName = String.fromCharCode(...nameBytes);
   316‚Üí      }
   317‚Üí    }
   318‚Üí
   319‚Üí    // Parse control definitions
   320‚Üí    // In READ responses: 0x48 [ID] 0x02 [TYPE] [CH] 0x01 0x48 [MIN] [CC] [MAX]
   321‚Üí    // In WRITE commands: 0x49 [ID] 0x02 [TYPE] [CH] 0x01 0x40 [MIN] [CC] [MAX] 0x00
   322‚Üí
   323‚Üí    // Find where controls actually start (after name and terminator)
   324‚Üí    let controlsStart = nameEnd > 0 ? nameEnd + 2 : 0; // Skip 0x21 0x00 after name
   325‚Üí
   326‚Üí    for (let i = controlsStart; i < data.length - 9; i++) {
   327‚Üí      // Handle both 0x48 (read) and 0x49 (write) markers
   328‚Üí      if (data[i] === 0x48 || data[i] === 0x49) {
   329‚Üí        if (i + 9 < data.length) {
   330‚Üí          const controlId = data[i + 1];
   331‚Üí          const defType = data[i + 2];
   332‚Üí          const _controlType = data[i + 3];
   333‚Üí          const channel = data[i + 4];
   334‚Üí          const param1 = data[i + 5];
   335‚Üí
   336‚Üí          // Validate it's a control structure (not part of name or other data)
   337‚Üí          const isValidControl = defType === 0x02 &&
   338‚Üí                                (param1 === 0x01 || param1 === 0x00) &&
   339‚Üí                                controlId !== undefined && controlId <= 0x3F; // Valid control ID range
   340‚Üí
   341‚Üí          if (isValidControl && controlId !== undefined) {
   342‚Üí            const minValue = data[i + 7];
   343‚Üí            const ccNumber = data[i + 8];
   344‚Üí            const maxValue = data[i + 9];
   345‚Üí
   346‚Üí            // Ensure all required values are defined
   347‚Üí            if (minValue !== undefined && ccNumber !== undefined && maxValue !== undefined &&
   348‚Üí                channel !== undefined && _controlType !== undefined) {
   349‚Üí              // Determine control behavior
   350‚Üí              let behaviour = 'absolute';
   351‚Üí
   352‚Üí              controls.push({
   353‚Üí                controlId,
   354‚Üí                channel,
   355‚Üí                ccNumber,
   356‚Üí                minValue,
   357‚Üí                maxValue,
   358‚Üí                behaviour: behaviour as any,
   359‚Üí              });
   360‚Üí
   361‚Üí              // Create color mapping based on control ID
   362‚Üí              let color = 0x3F; // Default
   363‚Üí              if (controlId >= 0x10 && controlId <= 0x17) {
   364‚Üí                color = 0x60; // Blue for top row encoders
   365‚Üí              } else if (controlId >= 0x18 && controlId <= 0x1F) {
   366‚Üí                color = 0x48; // Yellow for middle row encoders
   367‚Üí              } else if (controlId >= 0x20 && controlId <= 0x27) {
   368‚Üí                color = 0x3C; // Green for bottom row encoders
   369‚Üí              } else if (controlId >= 0x28 && controlId <= 0x3F) {
   370‚Üí                color = 0x0F; // Red for buttons/other controls
   371‚Üí              } else if (controlId <= 0x07) {
   372‚Üí                color = 0x0F; // Red for faders
   373‚Üí              }
   374‚Üí
   375‚Üí              colors.push({
   376‚Üí                controlId,
   377‚Üí                color,
   378‚Üí                behaviour: 'static', // Default behavior
   379‚Üí              });
   380‚Üí            }
   381‚Üí
   382‚Üí            // Skip to next potential control (9 bytes processed)
   383‚Üí            i += 9;
   384‚Üí          }
   385‚Üí        }
   386‚Üí      }
   387‚Üí    }
   388‚Üí
   389‚Üí    const result: { controls: ControlMapping[]; colors: ColorMapping[]; name?: string } = {
   390‚Üí      controls,
   391‚Üí      colors
   392‚Üí    };
   393‚Üí
   394‚Üí    if (modeName !== undefined) {
   395‚Üí      result.name = modeName;
   396‚Üí    }
   397‚Üí
   398‚Üí    return result;
   399‚Üí  }

   401‚Üí  /**
   402‚Üí   * Build device inquiry request
   403‚Üí   */
   404‚Üí  static buildDeviceQuery(): number[] {
   405‚Üí    return [
   406‚Üí      0xF0, // SysEx start
   407‚Üí      0x7E, // Universal non-realtime
   408‚Üí      0x00, // Device ID (broadcast)
   409‚Üí      0x06, // General information
   410‚Üí      0x01, // Identity request
   411‚Üí      0xF7, // SysEx end
   412‚Üí    ];
   413‚Üí  }
   414‚Üí
   415‚Üí  /**
   416‚Üí   * Build template change message
   417‚Üí   */
   418‚Üí  static buildTemplateChange(templateNumber: number): number[] {
   419‚Üí    if (templateNumber < 0 || templateNumber > 15) {
   420‚Üí      throw new Error('Template number must be 0-15');
   421‚Üí    }
   422‚Üí
   423‚Üí    return [
   424‚Üí      0xF0, // SysEx start
   425‚Üí      ...MANUFACTURER_ID,
   426‚Üí      0x11, // Device ID (Launch Control XL)
   427‚Üí      SysExMessageType.TEMPLATE_CHANGE,
   428‚Üí      templateNumber,
   429‚Üí      0xF7, // SysEx end
   430‚Üí    ];
   431‚Üí  }
   432‚Üí
   433‚Üí  /**
   434‚Üí   * Build custom mode read request
   435‚Üí   */
   436‚Üí  static buildCustomModeReadRequest(slot: number): number[] {
   437‚Üí    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
   438‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
   439‚Üí    }
   440‚Üí
   441‚Üí    // CORRECTED PROTOCOL: Based on working MIDI capture from web editor
   442‚Üí    // Format: F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 40 [SLOT] 00 F7
   443‚Üí    return [
   444‚Üí      0xF0,             // SysEx start
   445‚Üí      0x00, 0x20, 0x29, // Manufacturer ID (Novation)
   446‚Üí      0x02,             // Device ID (Launch Control XL 3)
   447‚Üí      0x15,             // Command (Custom mode)
   448‚Üí      0x05,             // Sub-command
   449‚Üí      0x00,             // Reserved
   450‚Üí      0x40,             // Read operation (CORRECTED from 0x15)
   451‚Üí      slot,             // Slot number (0-14 for slots 1-15)
   452‚Üí      0x00,             // Parameter (CORRECTED from nothing)
   453‚Üí      0xF7              // SysEx end
   454‚Üí    ];
   455‚Üí  }
   456‚Üí
   457‚Üí  /**
   458‚Üí   * Build custom mode write message from CustomMode object
   459‚Üí   */
   460‚Üí  static buildCustomModeWriteMessage(slot: number, customMode: CustomMode): number[] {
   461‚Üí    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
   462‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
   463‚Üí    }
   464‚Üí
   465‚Üí    const rawData: number[] = [];
   466‚Üí
   467‚Üí    // Header: Mode data format indicator
   468‚Üí    rawData.push(0x00, 0x20, 0x08);
   469‚Üí
   470‚Üí    // Mode name: Direct ASCII encoding (max 8 chars)
   471‚Üí    const nameBytes = customMode.name.substring(0, 8);
   472‚Üí    for (let i = 0; i < nameBytes.length; i++) {
   473‚Üí      rawData.push(nameBytes.charCodeAt(i));
   474‚Üí    }
   475‚Üí
   476‚Üí    // Sort controls by ID for consistency
   477‚Üí    const sortedControls = Object.values(customMode.controls)
   478‚Üí      .filter(control => control.controlId !== undefined)
   479‚Üí      .sort((a, b) => (a.controlId ?? 0) - (b.controlId ?? 0));
   480‚Üí
   481‚Üí    // Add control definitions with 0x49 marker and offset
   482‚Üí    for (const control of sortedControls) {
   483‚Üí      // Write control structure: 11 bytes
   484‚Üí      rawData.push(0x49); // Write control marker
   485‚Üí      rawData.push((control.controlId ?? 0) + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
   486‚Üí      rawData.push(0x02); // Definition type
   487‚Üí      // Convert control type to number if it's a string
   488‚Üí      const controlType = control.controlType ?? control.type ?? 0x00;
   489‚Üí      const controlTypeNum = typeof controlType === 'string' ?
   490‚Üí        (controlType === 'knob' ? 0x05 : controlType === 'fader' ? 0x00 : controlType === 'button' ? 0x09 : 0x00) :
   491‚Üí        controlType;
   492‚Üí      rawData.push(controlTypeNum); // Control type
   493‚Üí      rawData.push(control.midiChannel ?? control.channel ?? 0); // MIDI channel (0-15)
   494‚Üí      rawData.push(0x01); // Parameter 1
   495‚Üí      rawData.push(0x40); // Parameter 2
   496‚Üí      rawData.push(0x00); // Min value (always 0 in write)
   497‚Üí      rawData.push(control.ccNumber ?? control.cc ?? 0); // CC number
   498‚Üí      rawData.push(0x7F); // Max value (always 0x7F in write)
   499‚Üí      rawData.push(0x00); // Terminator
   500‚Üí    }
   501‚Üí
   502‚Üí    // Add label data if present
   503‚Üí    if (customMode.labels && customMode.labels.size > 0) {
   504‚Üí      for (const [controlId, label] of customMode.labels) {
   505‚Üí        rawData.push(0x69); // Label marker
   506‚Üí        rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
   507‚Üí        // Add label text
   508‚Üí        for (let i = 0; i < label.length; i++) {
   509‚Üí          rawData.push(label.charCodeAt(i));
   510‚Üí        }
   511‚Üí      }
   512‚Üí    } else {
   513‚Üí      // Generate default labels for controls
   514‚Üí      for (const control of sortedControls) {
   515‚Üí        const controlId = control.controlId ?? 0;
   516‚Üí        rawData.push(0x69); // Label marker
   517‚Üí        rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
   518‚Üí        const label = this.generateControlLabel(controlId);
   519‚Üí        for (let i = 0; i < label.length; i++) {
   520‚Üí          rawData.push(label.charCodeAt(i));
   521‚Üí        }
   522‚Üí      }
   523‚Üí    }
   524‚Üí
   525‚Üí    // Add color data if present
   526‚Üí    if (customMode.colors && customMode.colors.size > 0) {
   527‚Üí      for (const [controlId, color] of customMode.colors) {
   528‚Üí        rawData.push(0x60); // Color marker
   529‚Üí        rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
   530‚Üí        rawData.push(color); // Color value
   531‚Üí      }
   532‚Üí    } else {
   533‚Üí      // Add default colors (off) for all controls
   534‚Üí      for (const control of sortedControls) {
   535‚Üí        const controlId = control.controlId ?? 0;
   536‚Üí        rawData.push(0x60); // Color marker
   537‚Üí        rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
   538‚Üí      }
   539‚Üí    }
   540‚Üí
   541‚Üí    // Build complete message
   542‚Üí    return [
   543‚Üí      0xF0,             // SysEx start
   544‚Üí      0x00, 0x20, 0x29, // Manufacturer ID (Novation)
   545‚Üí      0x02,             // Device ID (Launch Control XL 3)
   546‚Üí      0x15,             // Command (Custom mode)
   547‚Üí      0x05,             // Sub-command
   548‚Üí      0x00,             // Reserved
   549‚Üí      0x45,             // Write operation
   550‚Üí      slot,             // Slot number
   551‚Üí      ...rawData,       // Custom mode data
   552‚Üí      0xF7              // SysEx end
   553‚Üí    ];
   554‚Üí  }
   555‚Üí
   556‚Üí  /**
   557‚Üí   * Build custom mode write request
   558‚Üí   */
   559‚Üí  static buildCustomModeWriteRequest(slot: number, modeData: CustomModeMessage): number[] {
   560‚Üí    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
   561‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
   562‚Üí    }
   563‚Üí
   564‚Üí    // Validate the custom mode data
   565‚Üí    this.validateCustomModeData(modeData);
   566‚Üí
   567‚Üí    // Encode the custom mode data
   568‚Üí    const encodedData = this.encodeCustomModeData(modeData);
   569‚Üí
   570‚Üí    // CORRECTED PROTOCOL: Based on Launch Control XL 3 format
   571‚Üí    // Format: F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 45 [SLOT] [encoded data] F7
   572‚Üí    return [
   573‚Üí      0xF0,             // SysEx start
   574‚Üí      0x00, 0x20, 0x29, // Manufacturer ID (Novation)
   575‚Üí      0x02,             // Device ID (Launch Control XL 3)
   576‚Üí      0x15,             // Command (Custom mode)
   577‚Üí      0x05,             // Sub-command
   578‚Üí      0x00,             // Reserved
   579‚Üí      0x45,             // Write operation (assumed based on pattern)
   580‚Üí      slot,             // Slot number (0-14 for slots 1-15)
   581‚Üí      ...encodedData,   // Encoded custom mode data
   582‚Üí      0xF7              // SysEx end
   583‚Üí    ];
   584‚Üí  }
   585‚Üí
   586‚Üí  /**
   587‚Üí   * Validate custom mode data
   588‚Üí   */
   589‚Üí  static validateCustomModeData(modeData: CustomModeMessage): void {
   590‚Üí    if (!modeData.controls || !Array.isArray(modeData.controls)) {
   591‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode must have controls array');
   592‚Üí    }
   593‚Üí
   594‚Üí    if (!modeData.colors || !Array.isArray(modeData.colors)) {
   595‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode must have colors array');
   596‚Üí    }
   597‚Üí
   598‚Üí    // Validate each control mapping
   599‚Üí    for (const control of modeData.controls) {
   600‚Üí      const ccNumber = control.ccNumber ?? control.cc ?? 0;
   601‚Üí      if (ccNumber < 0 || ccNumber > 127) {
   602‚Üí        throw new Error('CC number must be 0-127');
   603‚Üí      }
   604‚Üí
   605‚Üí      const channel = control.channel ?? control.midiChannel ?? 0;
   606‚Üí      if (channel < 0 || channel > 15) {
   607‚Üí        throw new Error('Channel must be 0-15');
   608‚Üí      }
   609‚Üí
   610‚Üí      const minValue = control.minValue ?? control.min ?? 0;
   611‚Üí      if (minValue < 0 || minValue > 127) {
   612‚Üí        throw new Error('Min value must be 0-127');
   613‚Üí      }
   614‚Üí
   615‚Üí      const maxValue = control.maxValue ?? control.max ?? 127;
   616‚Üí      if (maxValue < 0 || maxValue > 127) {
   617‚Üí        throw new Error('Max value must be 0-127');
   618‚Üí      }
   619‚Üí
   620‚Üí      if (minValue > maxValue) {
   621‚Üí        throw new Error('Min value cannot be greater than max value');
   622‚Üí      }
   623‚Üí    }
   624‚Üí
   625‚Üí    // Validate each color mapping
   626‚Üí    for (const color of modeData.colors) {
   627‚Üí      if (color.color < 0 || color.color > 127) {
   628‚Üí        throw new Error('Color value must be 0-127');
   629‚Üí      }
   630‚Üí    }
   631‚Üí  }
   632‚Üí
   633‚Üí  /**
   634‚Üí   * Encode custom mode data for Launch Control XL 3 transmission
   635‚Üí   * Based on actual web editor protocol analysis
   636‚Üí   */
   637‚Üí  private static encodeCustomModeData(modeData: CustomModeMessage): number[] {
   638‚Üí    const rawData: number[] = [];
   639‚Üí
   640‚Üí    // Header: Mode data format indicator
   641‚Üí    rawData.push(0x00, 0x20, 0x08);
   642‚Üí
   643‚Üí    // Mode name: Direct ASCII encoding (not Midimunge!)
   644‚Üí    if (modeData.name) {
   645‚Üí      for (let i = 0; i < modeData.name.length && i < 16; i++) {
   646‚Üí        rawData.push(modeData.name.charCodeAt(i));
   647‚Üí      }
   648‚Üí    }
   649‚Üí
   650‚Üí    // Add control definitions - must be in specific order for device to accept
   651‚Üí    // Sort controls by ID to ensure proper order
   652‚Üí    const sortedControls = [...modeData.controls]
   653‚Üí      .filter(control => control.controlId !== undefined)
   654‚Üí      .sort((a, b) => (a.controlId ?? 0) - (b.controlId ?? 0));
   655‚Üí
   656‚Üí    for (const control of sortedControls) {
   657‚Üí      // Control format from web editor for WRITE operation:
   658‚Üí      // Faders: 0x49 [ID] 0x02 0x00 [CH] 0x01 0x40 0x00 [CC] 0x7F 0x00
   659‚Üí      // Top encoders: 0x49 [ID] 0x02 0x05 [CH] 0x01 0x40 0x00 [CC] 0x7F 0x00
   660‚Üí      // Mid encoders: 0x49 [ID] 0x02 0x09 [CH] 0x01 0x40 0x00 [CC] 0x7F 0x00
   661‚Üí      // Bot encoders: 0x49 [ID] 0x02 0x0D [CH] 0x01 0x40 0x00 [CC] 0x7F 0x00
   662‚Üí
   663‚Üí      const controlId = control.controlId ?? 0;
   664‚Üí      const channel = control.channel ?? control.midiChannel ?? 0;
   665‚Üí      const ccNumber = control.ccNumber ?? control.cc ?? 0;
   666‚Üí
   667‚Üí      rawData.push(0x49); // Control marker for WRITE
   668‚Üí      rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // IMPORTANT: Add 0x28 offset for controls!
   669‚Üí      rawData.push(0x02); // Control definition type
   670‚Üí
   671‚Üí      // Control type based on hardware position
   672‚Üí      let controlType = 0x00;
   673‚Üí      if (controlId >= 0x10 && controlId <= 0x17) {
   674‚Üí        controlType = 0x05; // Top row encoders
   675‚Üí      } else if (controlId >= 0x18 && controlId <= 0x1F) {
   676‚Üí        controlType = 0x09; // Middle row encoders
   677‚Üí      } else if (controlId >= 0x20 && controlId <= 0x27) {
   678‚Üí        controlType = 0x0D; // Bottom row encoders
   679‚Üí      } else if (controlId >= 0x00 && controlId <= 0x07) {
   680‚Üí        controlType = 0x00; // Faders
   681‚Üí      }
   682‚Üí
   683‚Üí      rawData.push(controlType);
   684‚Üí      rawData.push(channel); // Channel (0-based)
   685‚Üí      rawData.push(0x01); // Parameter 1
   686‚Üí      rawData.push(0x40); // Parameter 2 (behavior)
   687‚Üí      rawData.push(0x00); // Min value (always 0x00 in write)
   688‚Üí      rawData.push(ccNumber); // CC number
   689‚Üí      rawData.push(0x7F); // Max value (always 0x7F in write)
   690‚Üí      rawData.push(0x00); // Terminator
   691‚Üí    }
   692‚Üí
   693‚Üí    // CRITICAL: Add label/color data after controls - REQUIRED by device!
   694‚Üí    // Without this section, the device rejects the message

   696‚Üí    // Add label data for each control (recommended for usability)
   697‚Üí    for (const control of sortedControls) {
   698‚Üí      const controlId = control.controlId ?? 0;
   699‚Üí      rawData.push(0x69); // Label marker
   700‚Üí      rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
   701‚Üí
   702‚Üí      // Add a simple label based on control type and ID
   703‚Üí      const labelText = this.generateControlLabel(controlId);
   704‚Üí      for (let i = 0; i < labelText.length; i++) {
   705‚Üí        rawData.push(labelText.charCodeAt(i));
   706‚Üí      }
   707‚Üí    }
   708‚Üí
   709‚Üí    // Add color data for each control (required for device acceptance)
   710‚Üí    for (const control of sortedControls) {
   711‚Üí      const controlId = control.controlId ?? 0;
   712‚Üí      rawData.push(0x60); // Color marker
   713‚Üí      rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
   714‚Üí    }

   716‚Üí    return rawData;
   717‚Üí  }

   720‚Üí  /**
   721‚Üí   * Generate a simple label for a control based on its ID and type
   722‚Üí   */
   723‚Üí  private static generateControlLabel(controlId: number): string {
   724‚Üí    if (controlId >= 0x00 && controlId <= 0x07) {
   725‚Üí      return `Fader ${controlId + 1}`;
   726‚Üí    } else if (controlId >= 0x10 && controlId <= 0x17) {
   727‚Üí      return `Top ${controlId - 0x10 + 1}`;
   728‚Üí    } else if (controlId >= 0x18 && controlId <= 0x1F) {
   729‚Üí      return `Mid ${controlId - 0x18 + 1}`;
   730‚Üí    } else if (controlId >= 0x20 && controlId <= 0x27) {
   731‚Üí      return `Bot ${controlId - 0x20 + 1}`;
   732‚Üí    } else if (controlId >= 0x28 && controlId <= 0x3F) {
   733‚Üí      return `Btn ${controlId - 0x28 + 1}`;
   734‚Üí    } else {
   735‚Üí      return `Ctrl ${controlId}`;
   736‚Üí    }
   737‚Üí  }
   738‚Üí
   739‚Üí  /**
   740‚Üí   * Build LED control message
   741‚Üí   */
   742‚Üí  static buildLedControl(controlId: number, color: number, behaviour: 'static' | 'flash' | 'pulse' | 'flashing' | 'pulsing' = 'static'): number[] {
   743‚Üí    if (controlId < 0 || controlId > 127) {
   744‚Üí      throw new Error('Control ID must be 0-127');
   745‚Üí    }
   746‚Üí
   747‚Üí    if (color < 0 || color > 127) {
   748‚Üí      throw new Error('Color must be 0-127');
   749‚Üí    }
   750‚Üí
   751‚Üí    let behaviorByte = color;
   752‚Üí
   753‚Üí    if (behaviour === 'flash' || behaviour === 'flashing') {
   754‚Üí      behaviorByte |= 0x08;
   755‚Üí    } else if (behaviour === 'pulse' || behaviour === 'pulsing') {
   756‚Üí      behaviorByte |= 0x10;
   757‚Üí    }
   758‚Üí
   759‚Üí    return [
   760‚Üí      0xF0, // SysEx start
   761‚Üí      ...MANUFACTURER_ID,
   762‚Üí      0x11, // Device ID
   763‚Üí      SysExMessageType.LED_CONTROL,
   764‚Üí      controlId,
   765‚Üí      behaviorByte,
   766‚Üí      0xF7, // SysEx end
   767‚Üí    ];
   768‚Üí  }
   769‚Üí
   770‚Üí  /**
   771‚Üí   * Build LED reset message
   772‚Üí   */
   773‚Üí  static buildLedReset(): number[] {
   774‚Üí    return [
   775‚Üí      0xF0, // SysEx start
   776‚Üí      ...MANUFACTURER_ID,
   777‚Üí      0x11, // Device ID
   778‚Üí      SysExMessageType.RESET_LED,
   779‚Üí      0x00, // Reset all LEDs
   780‚Üí      0xF7, // SysEx end
   781‚Üí    ];
   782‚Üí  }
   783‚Üí
   784‚Üí  /**
   785‚Üí   * Check if data is a valid SysEx message
   786‚Üí   */
   787‚Üí  static isValidSysEx(data: number[]): boolean {
   788‚Üí    if (data.length < 3) {
   789‚Üí      return false;
   790‚Üí    }
   791‚Üí
   792‚Üí    return data[0] === 0xF0 && data[data.length - 1] === 0xF7;
   793‚Üí  }
   794‚Üí
   795‚Üí  /**
   796‚Üí   * Extract manufacturer ID from SysEx message
   797‚Üí   */
   798‚Üí  static getManufacturerId(data: number[]): number[] | null {
   799‚Üí    if (!this.isValidSysEx(data)) {
   800‚Üí      return null;
   801‚Üí    }
   802‚Üí
   803‚Üí    // Universal messages don't have manufacturer ID
   804‚Üí    const manufacturerByte = data[1];
   805‚Üí    if (manufacturerByte === undefined) {
   806‚Üí      return null;
   807‚Üí    }
   808‚Üí
   809‚Üí    if (manufacturerByte === 0x7E || manufacturerByte === 0x7F) {
   810‚Üí      return null;
   811‚Üí    }
   812‚Üí
   813‚Üí    // Extract 3-byte manufacturer ID
   814‚Üí    if (manufacturerByte === 0x00) {
   815‚Üí      return data.slice(1, 4);
   816‚Üí    }
   817‚Üí
   818‚Üí    // Single byte manufacturer ID
   819‚Üí    return [manufacturerByte];
   820‚Üí  }

   214‚Üí
   215‚Üí    const message: CustomModeMessage = {
   216‚Üí      type: 'custom_mode_response',
   217‚Üí      manufacturerId: MANUFACTURER_ID,
   218‚Üí      slot,
   219‚Üí      controls,
   220‚Üí      colors,
   221‚Üí      data,
   222‚Üí    };
   223‚Üí
   224‚Üí    if (name !== undefined) {
   225‚Üí      message.name = name;
   226‚Üí    }
   227‚Üí
   228‚Üí    return message;
   229‚Üí  }

   231‚Üí  /**
   232‚Üí   * Parse legacy custom mode response (for older devices)
   233‚Üí   */
   234‚Üí  private static parseCustomModeResponse(data: number[]): CustomModeMessage {
   235‚Üí    if (data.length < 4) {
   236‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid custom mode response');
   237‚Üí    }
   238‚Üí
   239‚Üí    const slot = data[2];
   240‚Üí    if (slot === undefined) {
   241‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid slot in custom mode response');
   242‚Üí    }
   243‚Üí    const encodedData = data.slice(3);
   244‚Üí
   245‚Üí    // Decode the Midimunge-encoded custom mode data
   246‚Üí    const decodedData = Midimunge.decode(encodedData);
   247‚Üí
   248‚Üí    // Parse the decoded data into control and color mappings
   249‚Üí    const { controls, colors } = this.parseCustomModeData(decodedData);
   250‚Üí
   251‚Üí    return {
   252‚Üí      type: 'custom_mode_response',
   253‚Üí      manufacturerId: MANUFACTURER_ID,
   254‚Üí      slot,
   255‚Üí      controls,
   256‚Üí      colors,
   257‚Üí      data,
   258‚Üí    };
   259‚Üí  }
   260‚Üí
   261‚Üí  /**
   262‚Üí   * Parse custom mode data from raw bytes
   263‚Üí   * Updated to handle Launch Control XL 3 format (not Midimunge)
   264‚Üí   * Note: Device uses 0x48 in READ responses, 0x49 in WRITE commands
   265‚Üí   */
   266‚Üí  private static parseCustomModeData(data: number[]): {
   267‚Üí    controls: ControlMapping[];
   268‚Üí    colors: ColorMapping[];
   269‚Üí    name?: string;
   270‚Üí  } {
   271‚Üí    const controls: ControlMapping[] = [];
   272‚Üí    const colors: ColorMapping[] = [];
   273‚Üí    let modeName: string | undefined;
   274‚Üí
   275‚Üí    // Parse mode name - look for ASCII after header pattern
   276‚Üí    let nameStart = -1;
   277‚Üí    let nameEnd = -1;
   278‚Üí
   279‚Üí    // Look for the 0x06 0x20 0x08 or 0x00 0x20 0x08 header pattern first
   280‚Üí    for (let i = 0; i < data.length - 3; i++) {
   281‚Üí      if ((data[i] === 0x06 || data[i] === 0x00) && data[i + 1] === 0x20 && data[i + 2] === 0x08) {
   282‚Üí        nameStart = i + 3;
   283‚Üí        break;
   284‚Üí      }
   285‚Üí    }
   286‚Üí
   287‚Üí    if (nameStart > 0) {
   288‚Üí      const nameBytes = [];
   289‚Üí      for (let i = nameStart; i < data.length - 1; i++) {
   290‚Üí        // FIXED: Stop at explicit terminator 0x21 0x00 first
   291‚Üí        if (data[i] === 0x21 && data[i + 1] === 0x00) {
   292‚Üí          nameEnd = i;
   293‚Üí          break;
   294‚Üí        }
   295‚Üí
   296‚Üí        // Only break on control marker if we haven't found a name terminator
   297‚Üí        // and we're at least 8 bytes past the start (max mode name length)
   298‚Üí        if (data[i] === 0x48 && i >= nameStart + 8) {
   299‚Üí          // Double-check this is actually a control marker by validating structure
   300‚Üí          if (i + 9 < data.length &&
   301‚Üí              data[i + 2] === 0x02 && // Definition type
   302‚Üí              data[i + 1] !== undefined && data[i + 1]! <= 0x3F) {  // Valid control ID range
   303‚Üí            nameEnd = i;
   304‚Üí            break;
   305‚Üí          }
   306‚Üí        }
   307‚Üí
   308‚Üí        const byte = data[i];
   309‚Üí        if (byte !== undefined && byte >= 32 && byte <= 126) { // Printable ASCII
   310‚Üí          nameBytes.push(byte);
   311‚Üí        }
   312‚Üí      }
   313‚Üí
   314‚Üí      if (nameBytes.length > 0) {
   315‚Üí        modeName = String.fromCharCode(...nameBytes);
   316‚Üí      }
   317‚Üí    }
   318‚Üí
   319‚Üí    // Parse control definitions
   320‚Üí    // In READ responses: 0x48 [ID] 0x02 [TYPE] [CH] 0x01 0x48 [MIN] [CC] [MAX]
   321‚Üí    // In WRITE commands: 0x49 [ID] 0x02 [TYPE] [CH] 0x01 0x40 [MIN] [CC] [MAX] 0x00
   322‚Üí
   323‚Üí    // Find where controls actually start (after name and terminator)
   324‚Üí    let controlsStart = nameEnd > 0 ? nameEnd + 2 : 0; // Skip 0x21 0x00 after name
   325‚Üí
   326‚Üí    for (let i = controlsStart; i < data.length - 9; i++) {
   327‚Üí      // Handle both 0x48 (read) and 0x49 (write) markers
   328‚Üí      if (data[i] === 0x48 || data[i] === 0x49) {
   329‚Üí        if (i + 9 < data.length) {
   330‚Üí          const controlId = data[i + 1];
   331‚Üí          const defType = data[i + 2];
   332‚Üí          const _controlType = data[i + 3];
   333‚Üí          const channel = data[i + 4];
   334‚Üí          const param1 = data[i + 5];
   335‚Üí
   336‚Üí          // Validate it's a control structure (not part of name or other data)
   337‚Üí          const isValidControl = defType === 0x02 &&
   338‚Üí                                (param1 === 0x01 || param1 === 0x00) &&
   339‚Üí                                controlId !== undefined && controlId <= 0x3F; // Valid control ID range
   340‚Üí
   341‚Üí          if (isValidControl && controlId !== undefined) {
   342‚Üí            const minValue = data[i + 7];
   343‚Üí            const ccNumber = data[i + 8];
   344‚Üí            const maxValue = data[i + 9];
   345‚Üí
   346‚Üí            // Ensure all required values are defined
   347‚Üí            if (minValue !== undefined && ccNumber !== undefined && maxValue !== undefined &&
   348‚Üí                channel !== undefined && _controlType !== undefined) {
   349‚Üí              // Determine control behavior
   350‚Üí              let behaviour = 'absolute';
   351‚Üí
   352‚Üí              controls.push({
   353‚Üí                controlId,
   354‚Üí                channel,
   355‚Üí                ccNumber,
   356‚Üí                minValue,
   357‚Üí                maxValue,
   358‚Üí                behaviour: behaviour as any,
   359‚Üí              });
   360‚Üí
   361‚Üí              // Create color mapping based on control ID
   362‚Üí              let color = 0x3F; // Default
   363‚Üí              if (controlId >= 0x10 && controlId <= 0x17) {
   364‚Üí                color = 0x60; // Blue for top row encoders
   365‚Üí              } else if (controlId >= 0x18 && controlId <= 0x1F) {
   366‚Üí                color = 0x48; // Yellow for middle row encoders
   367‚Üí              } else if (controlId >= 0x20 && controlId <= 0x27) {
   368‚Üí                color = 0x3C; // Green for bottom row encoders
   369‚Üí              } else if (controlId >= 0x28 && controlId <= 0x3F) {
   370‚Üí                color = 0x0F; // Red for buttons/other controls
   371‚Üí              } else if (controlId <= 0x07) {
   372‚Üí                color = 0x0F; // Red for faders
   373‚Üí              }
   374‚Üí
   375‚Üí              colors.push({
   376‚Üí                controlId,
   377‚Üí                color,
   378‚Üí                behaviour: 'static', // Default behavior
   379‚Üí              });
   380‚Üí            }
   381‚Üí
   382‚Üí            // Skip to next potential control (9 bytes processed)
   383‚Üí            i += 9;
   384‚Üí          }
   385‚Üí        }
   386‚Üí      }
   387‚Üí    }
   388‚Üí
   389‚Üí    const result: { controls: ControlMapping[]; colors: ColorMapping[]; name?: string } = {
   390‚Üí      controls,
   391‚Üí      colors
   392‚Üí    };
   393‚Üí
   394‚Üí    if (modeName !== undefined) {
   395‚Üí      result.name = modeName;
   396‚Üí    }
   397‚Üí
   398‚Üí    return result;
   399‚Üí  }

   401‚Üí  /**
   402‚Üí   * Build device inquiry request
   403‚Üí   */
   404‚Üí  static buildDeviceQuery(): number[] {
   405‚Üí    return [
   406‚Üí      0xF0, // SysEx start
   407‚Üí      0x7E, // Universal non-realtime
   408‚Üí      0x00, // Device ID (broadcast)
   409‚Üí      0x06, // General information
   410‚Üí      0x01, // Identity request
   411‚Üí      0xF7, // SysEx end
   412‚Üí    ];
   413‚Üí  }
   414‚Üí
   415‚Üí  /**
   416‚Üí   * Build template change message
   417‚Üí   */
   418‚Üí  static buildTemplateChange(templateNumber: number): number[] {
   419‚Üí    if (templateNumber < 0 || templateNumber > 15) {
   420‚Üí      throw new Error('Template number must be 0-15');
   421‚Üí    }
   422‚Üí
   423‚Üí    return [
   424‚Üí      0xF0, // SysEx start
   425‚Üí      ...MANUFACTURER_ID,
   426‚Üí      0x11, // Device ID (Launch Control XL)
   427‚Üí      SysExMessageType.TEMPLATE_CHANGE,
   428‚Üí      templateNumber,
   429‚Üí      0xF7, // SysEx end
   430‚Üí    ];
   431‚Üí  }
   432‚Üí
   433‚Üí  /**
   434‚Üí   * Build custom mode read request
   435‚Üí   */
   436‚Üí  static buildCustomModeReadRequest(slot: number): number[] {
   437‚Üí    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
   438‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
   439‚Üí    }
   440‚Üí
   441‚Üí    // CORRECTED PROTOCOL: Based on working MIDI capture from web editor
   442‚Üí    // Format: F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 40 [SLOT] 00 F7
   443‚Üí    return [
   444‚Üí      0xF0,             // SysEx start
   445‚Üí      0x00, 0x20, 0x29, // Manufacturer ID (Novation)
   446‚Üí      0x02,             // Device ID (Launch Control XL 3)
   447‚Üí      0x15,             // Command (Custom mode)
   448‚Üí      0x05,             // Sub-command
   449‚Üí      0x00,             // Reserved
   450‚Üí      0x40,             // Read operation (CORRECTED from 0x15)
   451‚Üí      slot,             // Slot number (0-14 for slots 1-15)
   452‚Üí      0x00,             // Parameter (CORRECTED from nothing)
   453‚Üí      0xF7              // SysEx end
   454‚Üí    ];
   455‚Üí  }
   456‚Üí
   457‚Üí  /**
   458‚Üí   * Build custom mode write message from CustomMode object
   459‚Üí   */
   460‚Üí  static buildCustomModeWriteMessage(slot: number, customMode: CustomMode): number[] {
   461‚Üí    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
   462‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
   463‚Üí    }
   464‚Üí
   465‚Üí    const rawData: number[] = [];
   466‚Üí
   467‚Üí    // Header: Mode data format indicator
   468‚Üí    rawData.push(0x00, 0x20, 0x08);
   469‚Üí
   470‚Üí    // Mode name: Direct ASCII encoding (max 8 chars)
   471‚Üí    const nameBytes = customMode.name.substring(0, 8);
   472‚Üí    for (let i = 0; i < nameBytes.length; i++) {
   473‚Üí      rawData.push(nameBytes.charCodeAt(i));
   474‚Üí    }
   475‚Üí
   476‚Üí    // Sort controls by ID for consistency
   477‚Üí    const sortedControls = Object.values(customMode.controls)
   478‚Üí      .filter(control => control.controlId !== undefined)
   479‚Üí      .sort((a, b) => (a.controlId ?? 0) - (b.controlId ?? 0));
   480‚Üí
   481‚Üí    // Add control definitions with 0x49 marker and offset
   482‚Üí    for (const control of sortedControls) {
   483‚Üí      // Write control structure: 11 bytes
   484‚Üí      rawData.push(0x49); // Write control marker
   485‚Üí      rawData.push((control.controlId ?? 0) + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
   486‚Üí      rawData.push(0x02); // Definition type
   487‚Üí      // Convert control type to number if it's a string
   488‚Üí      const controlType = control.controlType ?? control.type ?? 0x00;
   489‚Üí      const controlTypeNum = typeof controlType === 'string' ?
   490‚Üí        (controlType === 'knob' ? 0x05 : controlType === 'fader' ? 0x00 : controlType === 'button' ? 0x09 : 0x00) :
   491‚Üí        controlType;
   492‚Üí      rawData.push(controlTypeNum); // Control type
   493‚Üí      rawData.push(control.midiChannel ?? control.channel ?? 0); // MIDI channel (0-15)
   494‚Üí      rawData.push(0x01); // Parameter 1
   495‚Üí      rawData.push(0x40); // Parameter 2
   496‚Üí      rawData.push(0x00); // Min value (always 0 in write)
   497‚Üí      rawData.push(control.ccNumber ?? control.cc ?? 0); // CC number
   498‚Üí      rawData.push(0x7F); // Max value (always 0x7F in write)
   499‚Üí      rawData.push(0x00); // Terminator
   500‚Üí    }
   501‚Üí
   502‚Üí    // Add label data if present
   503‚Üí    if (customMode.labels && customMode.labels.size > 0) {
   504‚Üí      for (const [controlId, label] of customMode.labels) {
   505‚Üí        rawData.push(0x69); // Label marker
   506‚Üí        rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
   507‚Üí        // Add label text
   508‚Üí        for (let i = 0; i < label.length; i++) {
   509‚Üí          rawData.push(label.charCodeAt(i));
   510‚Üí        }
   511‚Üí      }
   512‚Üí    } else {
   513‚Üí      // Generate default labels for controls
   514‚Üí      for (const control of sortedControls) {
   515‚Üí        const controlId = control.controlId ?? 0;
   516‚Üí        rawData.push(0x69); // Label marker
   517‚Üí        rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
   518‚Üí        const label = this.generateControlLabel(controlId);
   519‚Üí        for (let i = 0; i < label.length; i++) {
   520‚Üí          rawData.push(label.charCodeAt(i));
   521‚Üí        }
   522‚Üí      }
   523‚Üí    }
   524‚Üí
   525‚Üí    // Add color data if present
   526‚Üí    if (customMode.colors && customMode.colors.size > 0) {
   527‚Üí      for (const [controlId, color] of customMode.colors) {
   528‚Üí        rawData.push(0x60); // Color marker
   529‚Üí        rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
   530‚Üí        rawData.push(color); // Color value
   531‚Üí      }
   532‚Üí    } else {
   533‚Üí      // Add default colors (off) for all controls
   534‚Üí      for (const control of sortedControls) {
   535‚Üí        const controlId = control.controlId ?? 0;
   536‚Üí        rawData.push(0x60); // Color marker
   537‚Üí        rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
   538‚Üí      }
   539‚Üí    }
   540‚Üí
   541‚Üí    // Build complete message
   542‚Üí    return [
   543‚Üí      0xF0,             // SysEx start
   544‚Üí      0x00, 0x20, 0x29, // Manufacturer ID (Novation)
   545‚Üí      0x02,             // Device ID (Launch Control XL 3)
   546‚Üí      0x15,             // Command (Custom mode)
   547‚Üí      0x05,             // Sub-command
   548‚Üí      0x00,             // Reserved
   549‚Üí      0x45,             // Write operation
   550‚Üí      slot,             // Slot number
   551‚Üí      ...rawData,       // Custom mode data
   552‚Üí      0xF7              // SysEx end
   553‚Üí    ];
   554‚Üí  }
   555‚Üí
   556‚Üí  /**
   557‚Üí   * Build custom mode write request
   558‚Üí   */
   559‚Üí  static buildCustomModeWriteRequest(slot: number, modeData: CustomModeMessage): number[] {
   560‚Üí    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
   561‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
   562‚Üí    }
   563‚Üí
   564‚Üí    // Validate the custom mode data
   565‚Üí    this.validateCustomModeData(modeData);
   566‚Üí
   567‚Üí    // Encode the custom mode data
   568‚Üí    const encodedData = this.encodeCustomModeData(modeData);
   569‚Üí
   570‚Üí    // CORRECTED PROTOCOL: Based on Launch Control XL 3 format
   571‚Üí    // Format: F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 45 [SLOT] [encoded data] F7
   572‚Üí    return [
   573‚Üí      0xF0,             // SysEx start
   574‚Üí      0x00, 0x20, 0x29, // Manufacturer ID (Novation)
   575‚Üí      0x02,             // Device ID (Launch Control XL 3)
   576‚Üí      0x15,             // Command (Custom mode)
   577‚Üí      0x05,             // Sub-command
   578‚Üí      0x00,             // Reserved
   579‚Üí      0x45,             // Write operation (assumed based on pattern)
   580‚Üí      slot,             // Slot number (0-14 for slots 1-15)
   581‚Üí      ...encodedData,   // Encoded custom mode data
   582‚Üí      0xF7              // SysEx end
   583‚Üí    ];
   584‚Üí  }
   585‚Üí
   586‚Üí  /**
   587‚Üí   * Validate custom mode data
   588‚Üí   */
   589‚Üí  static validateCustomModeData(modeData: CustomModeMessage): void {
   590‚Üí    if (!modeData.controls || !Array.isArray(modeData.controls)) {
   591‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode must have controls array');
   592‚Üí    }
   593‚Üí
   594‚Üí    if (!modeData.colors || !Array.isArray(modeData.colors)) {
   595‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode must have colors array');
   596‚Üí    }
   597‚Üí
   598‚Üí    // Validate each control mapping
   599‚Üí    for (const control of modeData.controls) {
   600‚Üí      const ccNumber = control.ccNumber ?? control.cc ?? 0;
   601‚Üí      if (ccNumber < 0 || ccNumber > 127) {
   602‚Üí        throw new Error('CC number must be 0-127');
   603‚Üí      }
   604‚Üí
   605‚Üí      const channel = control.channel ?? control.midiChannel ?? 0;
   606‚Üí      if (channel < 0 || channel > 15) {
   607‚Üí        throw new Error('Channel must be 0-15');
   608‚Üí      }
   609‚Üí
   610‚Üí      const minValue = control.minValue ?? control.min ?? 0;
   611‚Üí      if (minValue < 0 || minValue > 127) {
   612‚Üí        throw new Error('Min value must be 0-127');
   613‚Üí      }
   614‚Üí
   615‚Üí      const maxValue = control.maxValue ?? control.max ?? 127;
   616‚Üí      if (maxValue < 0 || maxValue > 127) {
   617‚Üí        throw new Error('Max value must be 0-127');
   618‚Üí      }
   619‚Üí
   620‚Üí      if (minValue > maxValue) {
   621‚Üí        throw new Error('Min value cannot be greater than max value');
   622‚Üí      }
   623‚Üí    }
   624‚Üí
   625‚Üí    // Validate each color mapping
   626‚Üí    for (const color of modeData.colors) {
   627‚Üí      if (color.color < 0 || color.color > 127) {
   628‚Üí        throw new Error('Color value must be 0-127');
   629‚Üí      }
   630‚Üí    }
   631‚Üí  }
   632‚Üí
   633‚Üí  /**
   634‚Üí   * Encode custom mode data for Launch Control XL 3 transmission
   635‚Üí   * Based on actual web editor protocol analysis
   636‚Üí   */
   637‚Üí  private static encodeCustomModeData(modeData: CustomModeMessage): number[] {
   638‚Üí    const rawData: number[] = [];
   639‚Üí
   640‚Üí    // Header: Mode data format indicator
   641‚Üí    rawData.push(0x00, 0x20, 0x08);
   642‚Üí
   643‚Üí    // Mode name: Direct ASCII encoding (not Midimunge!)
   644‚Üí    if (modeData.name) {
   645‚Üí      for (let i = 0; i < modeData.name.length && i < 16; i++) {
   646‚Üí        rawData.push(modeData.name.charCodeAt(i));
   647‚Üí      }
   648‚Üí    }
   649‚Üí
   650‚Üí    // Add control definitions - must be in specific order for device to accept
   651‚Üí    // Sort controls by ID to ensure proper order
   652‚Üí    const sortedControls = [...modeData.controls]
   653‚Üí      .filter(control => control.controlId !== undefined)
   654‚Üí      .sort((a, b) => (a.controlId ?? 0) - (b.controlId ?? 0));
   655‚Üí
   656‚Üí    for (const control of sortedControls) {
   657‚Üí      // Control format from web editor for WRITE operation:
   658‚Üí      // Faders: 0x49 [ID] 0x02 0x00 [CH] 0x01 0x40 0x00 [CC] 0x7F 0x00
   659‚Üí      // Top encoders: 0x49 [ID] 0x02 0x05 [CH] 0x01 0x40 0x00 [CC] 0x7F 0x00
   660‚Üí      // Mid encoders: 0x49 [ID] 0x02 0x09 [CH] 0x01 0x40 0x00 [CC] 0x7F 0x00
   661‚Üí      // Bot encoders: 0x49 [ID] 0x02 0x0D [CH] 0x01 0x40 0x00 [CC] 0x7F 0x00
   662‚Üí
   663‚Üí      const controlId = control.controlId ?? 0;

    60‚Üí
    61‚Üífunction createMockMIDIOutput(id: string, name: string = `Output ${id}`): MockMIDIPort {

    76‚Üífunction createMockMIDIAccess(options: { sysexEnabled?: boolean } = {}): MockMIDIAccess {
    77‚Üí  const inputPort1 = createMockMIDIInput('input-1', 'Launch Control XL3');
    78‚Üí  const inputPort2 = createMockMIDIInput('input-2', 'USB MIDI Device');
    79‚Üí  const outputPort1 = createMockMIDIOutput('output-1', 'Launch Control XL3');
    80‚Üí  const outputPort2 = createMockMIDIOutput('output-2', 'USB MIDI Device');
    81‚Üí
    82‚Üí  return {
    83‚Üí    inputs: new Map([
    84‚Üí      ['input-1', inputPort1],
    85‚Üí      ['input-2', inputPort2]
    86‚Üí    ]),
    87‚Üí    outputs: new Map([
    88‚Üí      ['output-1', outputPort1],
    89‚Üí      ['output-2', outputPort2]
    90‚Üí    ]),
    91‚Üí    sysexEnabled: options.sysexEnabled ?? true,
    92‚Üí    onstatechange: null
    93‚Üí  };
    94‚Üí}

   206‚Üí  async sendMessage(data: number[]): Promise<void> {

   209‚Üí    }
   210‚Üí
   211‚Üí    if (!this.backend) {

   213‚Üí    }

   215‚Üí    const message: MidiMessage = {
   216‚Üí      timestamp: Date.now(),

   226‚Üí  async closeInput(): Promise<void> {

   248‚Üí  async cleanup(): Promise<void> {

   251‚Üí
   252‚Üí    if (this.backend) {

   254‚Üí    }

   256‚Üí    this.isInitialized = false;
   257‚Üí    this.messageBuffer = [];

   263‚Üí  isConnected(): boolean {
   264‚Üí    return !!(this.inputPort || this.outputPort);

   270‚Üí  getBufferedMessages(): MidiMessage[] {
   271‚Üí    return [...this.messageBuffer];
   272‚Üí  }

   277‚Üí  clearBuffer(): void {

   279‚Üí  }

   281‚Üí  /**
   282‚Üí   * Handle incoming MIDI message
   283‚Üí   */
   284‚Üí  private handleIncomingMessage(message: MidiMessage): void {
   285‚Üí    // Add to buffer
   286‚Üí    this.messageBuffer.push(message);
   287‚Üí
   288‚Üí    // Limit buffer size
   289‚Üí    if (this.messageBuffer.length > this.maxBufferSize) {
   290‚Üí      this.messageBuffer.shift();
   291‚Üí    }
   292‚Üí
   293‚Üí    // Parse and emit typed MIDI events
   294‚Üí    const data = message.data;
   295‚Üí    if (data.length > 0) {
   296‚Üí      const statusByte = data[0];
   297‚Üí      if (statusByte === undefined) return;
   298‚Üí      const channel = statusByte & 0x0F;
   299‚Üí      const messageType = statusByte & 0xF0;
   300‚Üí
   301‚Üí      const parsedMessage: MidiMessage = {
   302‚Üí        timestamp: message.timestamp,
   303‚Üí        data: data,
   304‚Üí        type: 'unknown',
   305‚Üí        channel
   306‚Üí      };
   307‚Üí
   308‚Üí      switch (messageType) {
   309‚Üí        case 0xB0: // Control Change
   310‚Üí          parsedMessage.type = 'controlchange';
   311‚Üí          parsedMessage.controller = data[1] ?? 0;
   312‚Üí          parsedMessage.value = data[2] ?? 0;
   313‚Üí          this.emit('controlchange', parsedMessage);
   314‚Üí          break;
   315‚Üí
   316‚Üí        case 0x90: // Note On
   317‚Üí          parsedMessage.type = 'noteon';
   318‚Üí          parsedMessage.note = data[1] ?? 0;
   319‚Üí          parsedMessage.velocity = data[2] ?? 0;
   320‚Üí          this.emit('noteon', parsedMessage);
   321‚Üí          break;
   322‚Üí
   323‚Üí        case 0x80: // Note Off
   324‚Üí          parsedMessage.type = 'noteoff';
   325‚Üí          parsedMessage.note = data[1] ?? 0;
   326‚Üí          parsedMessage.velocity = data[2] ?? 0;
   327‚Üí          this.emit('noteoff', parsedMessage);
   328‚Üí          break;
   329‚Üí
   330‚Üí        case 0xF0: // System Exclusive
   331‚Üí          if (data[data.length - 1] === 0xF7) {
   332‚Üí            parsedMessage.type = 'sysex';
   333‚Üí            this.emit('sysex', parsedMessage);
   334‚Üí          }
   335‚Üí          break;
   336‚Üí      }
   337‚Üí
   338‚Üí      // Always emit the generic message event
   339‚Üí      this.emit('message', message);
   340‚Üí    }
   341‚Üí  }

   343‚Üí  /**
   344‚Üí   * Auto-detect available MIDI backend

   346‚Üí  private async autoDetectBackend(): Promise<MidiBackendInterface> {
   347‚Üí    // Try node-midi first (Node.js environment)
   348‚Üí    try {

   354‚Üí

   358‚Üí      if (WebMidiBackend.isAvailable()) {

   361‚Üí    } catch (err) {

  async getInputPorts(): Promise<MidiPortInfo[]> {

    return [...this.inputPorts];

  async getOutputPorts(): Promise<MidiPortInfo[]> {
    if (!this.isInitialized) {

    return [...this.outputPorts];

    if (!portInfo) {

    this.openInputs.set(portId, mockPort);

    if (!portInfo) {

    this.openOutputs.set(portId, mockPort);

        0x00, // Device ID
        0x06, // Inquiry response
        0x02, // Sub-ID
        0x00, 0x20, 0x29, // Manufacturer ID (Novation)
        0x00, 0x61, // Family code
        0x00, 0x01, // Family member
        0x01, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, // Software revision
        0xF7, // End

      const message: MidiMessage = {

      inputPort.onMessage(message);

    const inputPort = this.openInputs.get('lcxl3-input');

  let deviceManager: DeviceManager;

    mockBackend = new MockMidiBackend();

    const options: DeviceManagerOptions = {
      midiBackend: mockBackend,
      autoConnect: false, // Control connection manually in tests
      inquiryTimeout: 1000, // Shorter timeout for tests
      retryAttempts: 2,
      retryDelay: 100
    };

    deviceManager = new DeviceManager(options);
  });

    await deviceManager.cleanup();
  });

      await expect(deviceManager.initialize()).resolves.not.toThrow();
    });

      const autoConnectManager = new DeviceManager({
        midiBackend: mockBackend,
        autoConnect: true,
        inquiryTimeout: 100
      });

      const connectSpy = vi.spyOn(autoConnectManager, 'connect');

      // Set up device inquiry response before connecting
      setTimeout(() => {
        mockBackend.simulateDeviceInquiryResponse();
      }, 50);

      await autoConnectManager.initialize();

      expect(connectSpy).toHaveBeenCalled();
      await autoConnectManager.cleanup();
    });

    it('should handle initialization errors gracefully', async () => {
      const errorBackend = {
        ...mockBackend,
        initialize: vi.fn().mockRejectedValue(new Error('Backend init failed'))
      };

      const errorManager = new DeviceManager({
        midiBackend: errorBackend as MidiBackendInterface
      });

      await expect(errorManager.initialize()).rejects.toThrow('Backend init failed');
    });
  });

      await deviceManager.initialize();
    });

      setTimeout(() => {
        mockBackend.simulateDeviceInquiryResponse();
      }, 50);

      await expect(connectPromise).resolves.not.toThrow();

/**
 * Device Handshake Integration Tests
 *
 * Integration tests for Feature MVP.2 (Device Handshake) covering:
 * - Complete handshake with mocked device
 * - End-to-end connection and verification flow
 * - Reconnection with handshake
 * - Multiple device handling
 * - Full workflow from discovery to communication
 */

import { describe, it, expect, vi, beforeEach, afterEach } from 'vitest';
import { DeviceManager, DeviceManagerOptions } from '@/device/DeviceManager';
import { MidiInterface, MidiBackendInterface, MidiPortInfo, MidiInputPort, MidiOutputPort, MidiMessage } from '@/core/MidiInterface';
import { SysExParser, MANUFACTURER_ID } from '@/core/SysExParser';
import type { DeviceInquiryResponse, LaunchControlXL3Info, DeviceMode, CustomMode } from '@/types/index';

/**
 * Advanced Mock MIDI Backend for Integration Testing
 * Simulates real-world device behavior with timing and state management
 */
class IntegrationMockBackend implements MidiBackendInterface {
  private isInitialized = false;
  private connectedDevices: Map<string, MockDevice> = new Map();
  private openInputs = new Map<string, MockInputPort>();
  private openOutputs = new Map<string, MockOutputPort>();

  // Device simulation parameters
  public deviceResponseDelay = 50; // ms
  public deviceInquiryEnabled = true;
  public templateChangeEnabled = true;
  public connectionStable = true;

  constructor() {
    this.setupDefaultDevices();
  }

  private setupDefaultDevices(): void {
    // Primary Launch Control XL3 device
    this.addDevice('lcxl3-primary', {
      inputName: 'LCXL3 1 MIDI Out',
      outputName: 'LCXL3 1 DAW In',
      manufacturerId: [0x00, 0x20, 0x29],
      familyCode: 0x61,
      familyMember: 0x01,
      firmwareVersion: [1, 2, 3, 4],
      serialNumber: [0x31, 0x32, 0x33, 0x34], // "1234"
      deviceId: 0x11
    });

    // Secondary device for multi-device testing
    this.addDevice('lcxl3-secondary', {
      inputName: 'LCXL3 2 MIDI Out',
      outputName: 'LCXL3 2 DAW In',
      manufacturerId: [0x00, 0x20, 0x29],
      familyCode: 0x61,
      familyMember: 0x01,
      firmwareVersion: [1, 2, 4, 0],
      serialNumber: [0x35, 0x36, 0x37, 0x38], // "5678"
      deviceId: 0x12
    });
  }

  addDevice(id: string, config: MockDeviceConfig): void {
    this.connectedDevices.set(id, new MockDevice(id, config));
  }

  removeDevice(id: string): void {
    this.connectedDevices.delete(id);
  }

  disconnectDevice(id: string): void {
    const device = this.connectedDevices.get(id);
    if (device) {
      device.connected = false;
    }
  }

  reconnectDevice(id: string): void {
    const device = this.connectedDevices.get(id);
    if (device) {
      device.connected = true;
    }
  }

  async initialize(): Promise<void> {
    this.isInitialized = true;
  }

  async getInputPorts(): Promise<MidiPortInfo[]> {
    if (!this.isInitialized) {
      throw new Error('Backend not initialized');
    }

    return Array.from(this.connectedDevices.values())
      .filter(device => device.connected)
      .map(device => ({
        id: `${device.id}-input`,
        name: device.config.inputName,
        manufacturer: 'Novation',
        version: device.config.firmwareVersion.join('.')
      }));
  }

  async getOutputPorts(): Promise<MidiPortInfo[]> {
    if (!this.isInitialized) {
      throw new Error('Backend not initialized');
    }

    return Array.from(this.connectedDevices.values())
      .filter(device => device.connected)
      .map(device => ({
        id: `${device.id}-output`,
        name: device.config.outputName,
        manufacturer: 'Novation',
        version: device.config.firmwareVersion.join('.')
      }));
  }

  async openInput(portId: string): Promise<MidiInputPort> {
    const deviceId = portId.replace('-input', '');
    const device = this.connectedDevices.get(deviceId);

    if (!device || !device.connected) {
      throw new Error(`Input port not found: ${portId}`);
    }

    const mockPort = new MockInputPort(portId, device.config.inputName, device, this);
    this.openInputs.set(portId, mockPort);
    return mockPort;
  }

  async openOutput(portId: string): Promise<MidiOutputPort> {
    const deviceId = portId.replace('-output', '');
    const device = this.connectedDevices.get(deviceId);

    if (!device || !device.connected) {
      throw new Error(`Output port not found: ${portId}`);
    }

    const mockPort = new MockOutputPort(portId, device.config.outputName, device, this);
    this.openOutputs.set(portId, mockPort);
    return mockPort;
  }

  async sendMessage(port: MidiOutputPort, message: MidiMessage): Promise<void> {
    const deviceId = port.id.replace('-output', '');
    const device = this.connectedDevices.get(deviceId);

    if (!device || !device.connected) {
      throw new Error(`Device not available: ${deviceId}`);
    }

    if (!this.connectionStable) {
      throw new Error('Connection unstable - message failed');
    }

    // Process the message and potentially generate responses
    await device.handleMessage(message, this);
  }

  async closePort(port: MidiInputPort | MidiOutputPort): Promise<void> {
    if (port.type === 'input') {
      this.openInputs.delete(port.id);
    } else {
      this.openOutputs.delete(port.id);
    }
  }

  async cleanup(): Promise<void> {
    this.openInputs.clear();
    this.openOutputs.clear();
    this.isInitialized = false;
  }

  // Test utilities
  getInputPort(portId: string): MockInputPort | undefined {
    return this.openInputs.get(portId);
  }

  getOutputPort(portId: string): MockOutputPort | undefined {
    return this.openOutputs.get(portId);
  }

  simulateConnectionLoss(deviceId: string): void {
    this.disconnectDevice(deviceId);

    // Notify open ports about disconnection
    const inputPort = this.openInputs.get(`${deviceId}-input`);
    const outputPort = this.openOutputs.get(`${deviceId}-output`);

    if (inputPort) {
      inputPort.simulateDisconnection();
    }
    if (outputPort) {
      outputPort.simulateDisconnection();
    }
  }
}

interface MockDeviceConfig {
  inputName: string;
  outputName: string;
  manufacturerId: number[];
  familyCode: number;
  familyMember: number;
  firmwareVersion: number[];
  serialNumber?: number[];
  deviceId: number;
}

class MockDevice {
  public connected = true;
  private currentTemplate = 0;
  private customModes = new Map<number, any>();

  constructor(
    public readonly id: string,
    public readonly config: MockDeviceConfig
  ) {}

  async handleMessage(message: MidiMessage, backend: IntegrationMockBackend): Promise<void> {
    if (message.type === 'sysex' || message.data[0] === 0xF0) {
      await this.handleSysExMessage(message, backend);
    }
  }

  private async handleSysExMessage(message: MidiMessage, backend: IntegrationMockBackend): Promise<void> {
    try {
      const parsed = SysExParser.parse([...message.data]);

      switch (parsed.type) {
        case 'device_inquiry':
          if (backend.deviceInquiryEnabled) {
            setTimeout(() => {
              this.sendDeviceInquiryResponse(backend);
            }, backend.deviceResponseDelay);
          }
          break;

        case 'template_change':
          if (backend.templateChangeEnabled) {
            const templateMsg = parsed as any;
            this.currentTemplate = templateMsg.templateNumber;
            setTimeout(() => {
              this.sendTemplateChangeConfirmation(backend, this.currentTemplate);
            }, backend.deviceResponseDelay);
          }
          break;

        case 'custom_mode_read':
          const readMsg = parsed as any;
          setTimeout(() => {
            this.sendCustomModeResponse(backend, readMsg.slot);
          }, backend.deviceResponseDelay);
          break;
      }
    } catch (error) {
      // Ignore invalid SysEx messages
    }
  }

  private sendDeviceInquiryResponse(backend: IntegrationMockBackend): void {
    const inputPort = backend.getInputPort(`${this.id}-input`);
    if (inputPort && inputPort.onMessage) {
      const responseData = [
        0xF0, // Start
        0x7E, // Universal non-realtime
        0x00, // Device ID
        0x06, // Inquiry response
        0x02, // Sub-ID
        ...this.config.manufacturerId,
        (this.config.familyCode >> 8) & 0x7F, this.config.familyCode & 0x7F,
        (this.config.familyMember >> 8) & 0x7F, this.config.familyMember & 0x7F,
        ...this.config.firmwareVersion,
        0xF7, // End
      ];

      const message: MidiMessage = {
        timestamp: Date.now(),
        data: responseData,
        type: 'sysex'
      };

      inputPort.onMessage(message);
    }
  }

  private sendTemplateChangeConfirmation(backend: IntegrationMockBackend, templateNumber: number): void {
    const inputPort = backend.getInputPort(`${this.id}-input`);
    if (inputPort && inputPort.onMessage) {
      const responseData = [
        0xF0, // Start
        ...MANUFACTURER_ID,
        this.config.deviceId,
        0x00, // Template change confirmation
        templateNumber,
        0xF7, // End
      ];

      const message: MidiMessage = {
        timestamp: Date.now(),
        data: responseData,
        type: 'sysex'
      };

      inputPort.onMessage(message);
    }
  }

  private sendCustomModeResponse(backend: IntegrationMockBackend, slot: number): void {
    const inputPort = backend.getInputPort(`${this.id}-input`);
    if (inputPort && inputPort.onMessage) {
      // Simulate custom mode data (simplified)
      const customMode = this.customModes.get(slot) || {
        slot,
        name: `Custom ${slot + 1}`,
        controls: [],
        colors: []
      };

      // Build custom mode response (simplified format)
      const responseData = [
        0xF0, // Start
        ...MANUFACTURER_ID,
        this.config.deviceId,
        0x01, // Custom mode response
        slot,
        ...Array.from(customMode.name).map((c: string) => c.charCodeAt(0)),
        0xF7, // End
      ];

      const message: MidiMessage = {
        timestamp: Date.now(),
        data: responseData,
        type: 'sysex'
      };

      inputPort.onMessage(message);
    }
  }
}

class MockInputPort implements MidiInputPort {
  readonly type = 'input' as const;
  onMessage?: ((message: MidiMessage) => void) | undefined;
  private disconnected = false;

  constructor(
    public readonly id: string,
    public readonly name: string,
    private device: MockDevice,
    private backend: IntegrationMockBackend
  ) {}

  async close(): Promise<void> {
    await this.backend.closePort(this);
  }

  simulateDisconnection(): void {
    this.disconnected = true;
  }

  simulateControlChange(controller: number, value: number, channel = 0): void {
    if (this.disconnected || !this.onMessage) return;

    const message: MidiMessage = {
      timestamp: Date.now(),
      data: [0xB0 | channel, controller, value],
      type: 'controlchange',
      channel,
      controller,
      value
    };

    this.onMessage(message);
  }
}

class MockOutputPort implements MidiOutputPort {
  readonly type = 'output' as const;
  public sentMessages: MidiMessage[] = [];

  constructor(
    public readonly id: string,
    public readonly name: string,
    private device: MockDevice,
    private backend: IntegrationMockBackend
  ) {}

  async close(): Promise<void> {
    await this.backend.closePort(this);
  }

  simulateDisconnection(): void {
    // Output ports don't receive messages, so just mark as disconnected
  }
}

describe('Device Handshake Integration Tests', () => {
  let backend: IntegrationMockBackend;
  let deviceManager: DeviceManager;

  beforeEach(() => {
    backend = new IntegrationMockBackend();

    const options: DeviceManagerOptions = {
      midiBackend: backend,
      autoConnect: false,
      inquiryTimeout: 2000, // Longer timeout for integration tests
      retryAttempts: 3,
      retryDelay: 200
    };

    deviceManager = new DeviceManager(options);
  });

  afterEach(async () => {
    await deviceManager.cleanup();
  });

  describe('complete handshake with mocked device', () => {
    it('should complete full handshake flow successfully', async () => {
      await deviceManager.initialize();

      // Track events during handshake
      const events: string[] = [];
      deviceManager.on('device:connected', () => events.push('connected'));
      deviceManager.on('device:ready', () => events.push('ready'));

      // Execute handshake
      await deviceManager.connect();

      // Verify connection state
      const status = deviceManager.getStatus();
      expect(status.connected).toBe(true);
      expect(status.state).toBe('connected');
      expect(status.deviceInfo).toBeDefined();

      // Verify handshake events occurred in order
      expect(events).toEqual(['connected', 'ready']);

      // Verify device information was received correctly
      expect(status.deviceInfo?.manufacturerId).toBe('00 20 29');
      expect(status.deviceInfo?.deviceFamily).toBe(0x61);
      expect(status.deviceInfo?.modelNumber).toBe(0x01);
      expect(status.deviceInfo?.firmwareVersion).toBe('1.2.3.4');
    });

    it('should handle handshake with device that responds slowly', async () => {
      backend.deviceResponseDelay = 500; // Slow device

      await deviceManager.initialize();

      const startTime = Date.now();
      await deviceManager.connect();
      const endTime = Date.now();

      // Should still connect successfully
      const status = deviceManager.getStatus();
      expect(status.connected).toBe(true);

      // Should have taken at least the response delay
      expect(endTime - startTime).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(400);
    });

    it('should handle handshake when device inquiry is disabled', async () => {
      backend.deviceInquiryEnabled = false;

      await deviceManager.initialize();

      // Should still connect with fallback device info in development mode
      const originalEnv = process.env.NODE_ENV;
      process.env.NODE_ENV = 'development';

      await deviceManager.connect();

      const status = deviceManager.getStatus();
      expect(status.connected).toBe(true);
      expect(status.deviceInfo?.firmwareVersion).toBe('Unknown');

      process.env.NODE_ENV = originalEnv;
    });

    it('should validate device response format during handshake', async () => {
      await deviceManager.initialize();

      // Corrupt the device response
      const originalSendResponse = backend.connectedDevices.get('lcxl3-primary')!['sendDeviceInquiryResponse'];
      backend.connectedDevices.get('lcxl3-primary')!['sendDeviceInquiryResponse'] = function(backend: IntegrationMockBackend) {
        const inputPort = backend.getInputPort(`${this.id}-input`);
        if (inputPort && inputPort.onMessage) {
          // Send malformed response
          const corruptedData = [0xF0, 0x7E, 0x00, 0x06, 0x02, 0xFF, 0xFF, 0xF7]; // Invalid manufacturer ID

          const message: MidiMessage = {
            timestamp: Date.now(),
            data: corruptedData,
            type: 'sysex'
          };

          inputPort.onMessage(message);
        }
      };

      // Should handle validation error gracefully
      const originalEnv = process.env.NODE_ENV;
      process.env.NODE_ENV = 'development';

      await deviceManager.connect();

      // Should still connect with fallback
      const status = deviceManager.getStatus();
      expect(status.connected).toBe(true);

      process.env.NODE_ENV = originalEnv;
    });
  });

  describe('end-to-end connection and verification flow', () => {
    it('should complete entire workflow from discovery to communication', async () => {
      await deviceManager.initialize();

      // Phase 1: Discovery and Connection
      await deviceManager.connect();

      let status = deviceManager.getStatus();
      expect(status.connected).toBe(true);

      // Phase 2: Device Communication
      const modeChangedSpy = vi.fn();
      deviceManager.on('device:modeChanged', modeChangedSpy);

      await deviceManager.selectTemplate(3);

      // Verify template change was processed
      expect(modeChangedSpy).toHaveBeenCalledWith({
        type: 'template',
        slot: 3
      });

      // Phase 3: Control Message Handling
      const controlChangeSpy = vi.fn();
      deviceManager.on('control:change', controlChangeSpy);

      // Simulate control input from device
      const inputPort = backend.getInputPort('lcxl3-primary-input') as MockInputPort;
      inputPort.simulateControlChange(13, 64, 0); // Send A knob 1

      expect(controlChangeSpy).toHaveBeenCalledWith('sendA1', 64, 0);

      // Phase 4: SysEx Communication
      const sysexSpy = vi.fn();
      deviceManager.on('sysex:received', sysexSpy);

      // Send custom SysEx message
      await deviceManager.sendSysEx([0xF0, 0x00, 0x20, 0x29, 0x11, 0x77, 0x00, 0xF7]);

      // Verify communication is working
      status = deviceManager.getStatus();
      expect(status.connected).toBe(true);

    it('should handle concurrent connection attempts gracefully', async () => {
      await deviceManager.initialize();

      // Start multiple connection attempts simultaneously
      const connection1 = deviceManager.connect();
      const connection2 = deviceManager.connect();
      const connection3 = deviceManager.connect();

      // All should resolve successfully (subsequent calls should be no-ops)
      await Promise.all([connection1, connection2, connection3]);

      const status = deviceManager.getStatus();
      expect(status.connected).toBe(true);
    });

    it('should handle backend initialization failures during handshake', async () => {
      // Create manager with backend that fails after initial success
      const failingBackend = new IntegrationMockBackend();
      const originalGetInputPorts = failingBackend.getInputPorts;

      failingBackend.getInputPorts = vi.fn().mockImplementation(async () => {
        // Fail on second call (during connection)
        if ((failingBackend.getInputPorts as any).mock.calls.length > 1) {
          throw new Error('Backend connection lost');
        }
        return originalGetInputPorts.call(failingBackend);
      });

      const errorManager = new DeviceManager({
        midiBackend: failingBackend,
        autoConnect: false
      });

      await errorManager.initialize();

      // First connection should succeed
      await errorManager.connect();
      await errorManager.disconnect();

      // Second connection should fail
      await expect(errorManager.connect()).rejects.toThrow('Backend connection lost');

      await errorManager.cleanup();
    });
  });
});

     /**
      * Verify device identity and retrieve hardware information
      * 
      * This method performs a fresh handshake with the connected device to verify
      * its identity and retrieve current hardware information including firmware version.
      * 
      * @returns Promise resolving to device information
      * @throws Error if device is not connected or handshake fails
      * 
      * @example
      * ```typescript
      * const device = new LaunchControlXL3();
      * await device.initialize();
      * await device.connect();
      * 
      * try {
      *   const deviceInfo = await device.verifyDevice();
      *   console.log('Device verified:', deviceInfo.firmwareVersion);
      * } catch (error) {
      *   console.error('Device verification failed:', error.message);
      * }
      * ```
      */
     async verifyDevice(): Promise<LaunchControlXL3Info> {
       const status = this.getStatus();
       
       if (!status.connected) {
         throw new Error(
           'Cannot verify device: not connected. Call connect() first to establish connection.'
         );
       }
       
       if (!status.deviceInfo) {
         // Trigger fresh handshake by reconnecting
         await this.disconnect();
         await this.connect();
         
         const newStatus = this.getStatus();
         if (!newStatus.deviceInfo) {
           throw new Error(
             'Device verification failed: unable to retrieve device information after reconnection. ' +
             'Ensure device supports SysEx communication.'
           );
         }
         return newStatus.deviceInfo;
       }
       
       return status.deviceInfo;
     }
     ```

#!/usr/bin/env tsx
/**
 * Node.js Handshake Test Script
 *
 * Tests the Launch Control XL 3 device handshake functionality using NodeMidiBackend.
 * This script will attempt to connect to a Launch Control XL 3 device and verify
 * its identity using the verifyDevice() method.
 *
 * Usage:
 *   tsx utils/test-handshake-node.ts
 *   npm run test:handshake:node
 *
 * Requirements:
 *   - Launch Control XL 3 device connected via USB
 *   - node-midi package installed (peer dependency)
 *   - Device should be powered on and ready
 */

import chalk from 'chalk';
import { LaunchControlXL3 } from '../src/index.js';
import { NodeMidiBackend } from '../src/core/backends/NodeMidiBackend.js';

// Console formatting helpers
const log = {
  info: (msg: string) => console.log(chalk.blue('‚Ñπ'), msg),
  success: (msg: string) => console.log(chalk.green('‚úì'), msg),
  error: (msg: string) => console.log(chalk.red('‚úó'), msg),
  warning: (msg: string) => console.log(chalk.yellow('‚ö†'), msg),
  step: (msg: string) => console.log(chalk.cyan('‚Üí'), msg),
  title: (msg: string) => console.log(chalk.bold.underline(msg)),
  data: (label: string, value: any) => console.log(chalk.gray(`  ${label}:`), chalk.white(value))
};

async function testHandshake(): Promise<void> {
  log.title('Launch Control XL 3 - Node.js Handshake Test');
  console.log('='.repeat(50));

  log.info('Testing device handshake functionality using NodeMidiBackend');
  console.log();

  let controller: LaunchControlXL3 | null = null;
  let success = false;

  try {
    // Step 1: Create NodeMidiBackend
    log.step('Creating NodeMidiBackend...');
    const backend = new NodeMidiBackend();

    // Step 2: Create LaunchControlXL3 instance with specific backend
    log.step('Creating LaunchControlXL3 instance...');
    controller = new LaunchControlXL3({
      midiBackend: backend,
      autoConnect: false, // We'll connect manually for better control
      enableLedControl: true,
      enableCustomModes: true,
    });

    // Step 3: Setup event handlers to monitor the process
    log.step('Setting up event handlers...');

    controller.on('device:connected', (device) => {
      log.success('Device connected successfully!');
      log.data('Manufacturer ID', device.manufacturerId);
      log.data('Family Code', device.familyCode);
      log.data('Model Number', device.modelNumber);
      log.data('Firmware Version', device.firmwareVersion);
      log.data('Serial Number', device.serialNumber || 'Not available');
    });

    controller.on('device:disconnected', (reason) => {
      log.warning(`Device disconnected: ${reason || 'Unknown reason'}`);
    });

    controller.on('device:error', (error) => {
      log.error(`Device error: ${error.message}`);
    });

    controller.on('device:ready', () => {
      log.success('Device is ready for operation!');
    });

    // Step 4: Initialize the controller
    log.step('Initializing controller...');
    await controller.initialize();

    // Step 5: Connect to device
    log.step('Connecting to Launch Control XL 3...');
    await controller.connect();

    // Wait a moment for connection to stabilize
    await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1000));

    // Step 6: Verify device handshake
    log.step('Performing device handshake verification...');
    const deviceInfo = await controller.verifyDevice();

    // Step 7: Display results
    console.log();
    log.success('Device handshake verification completed successfully!');
    console.log();
    log.title('Device Information:');
    log.data('Manufacturer ID', `0x${deviceInfo.manufacturerId.toString(16).padStart(2, '0').toUpperCase()}`);
    log.data('Family Code', `0x${deviceInfo.familyCode.toString(16).padStart(4, '0').toUpperCase()}`);
    log.data('Model Number', `0x${deviceInfo.modelNumber.toString(16).padStart(4, '0').toUpperCase()}`);
    log.data('Firmware Version', deviceInfo.firmwareVersion);
    if (deviceInfo.serialNumber) {
      log.data('Serial Number', deviceInfo.serialNumber);
    }

    // Step 8: Test device status
    console.log();
    log.step('Checking device status...');
    const status = controller.getStatus();
    log.data('Connected', status.connected);
    log.data('State', status.state);
    log.data('Last Seen', status.lastSeen?.toISOString() || 'Never');

    success = true;
    console.log();
    log.success('All tests passed! Device handshake is working correctly.');

  } catch (error: any) {
    console.log();
    log.error('Handshake test failed!');
    log.error(`Error: ${error.message}`);

    // Provide troubleshooting guidance
    console.log();
    log.title('Troubleshooting Guide:');

    if (error.message.includes('No MIDI')) {
      log.warning('No MIDI devices found. Check:');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ Launch Control XL 3 is connected via USB');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ Device is powered on and recognized by your system');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ Try reconnecting the USB cable');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ Check if device appears in your system\'s audio/MIDI settings');
    } else if (error.message.includes('node-midi')) {
      log.warning('node-midi package issue. Check:');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ Install node-midi: npm install midi');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ Make sure you have the required system dependencies');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ On macOS: Xcode command line tools');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ On Linux: libasound2-dev package');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ On Windows: Visual Studio build tools');
    } else if (error.message.includes('not connected')) {
      log.warning('Device connection failed. Check:');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ Device is not being used by another application');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ Try restarting the device (unplug and reconnect USB)');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ Ensure no other DAW or MIDI application is using the device');
    } else if (error.message.includes('handshake') || error.message.includes('timeout')) {
      log.warning('Device handshake failed. Check:');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ Device firmware is up to date');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ Try power cycling the device');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ Ensure device is in the correct mode (not in template mode)');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ Check USB cable for issues');
    } else {
      log.warning('Unexpected error. General troubleshooting:');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ Restart the device (unplug/reconnect USB)');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ Check system MIDI settings');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ Try running the test again');
      console.log('  ‚Ä¢ Check console for additional error details');
    }

    console.log();
    log.info('For more help, check the README.md or open an issue on GitHub.');
  } finally {
    // Cleanup
    if (controller) {
      try {
        log.step('Cleaning up...');
        await controller.cleanup();
        log.success('Cleanup completed.');
      } catch (cleanupError: any) {
        log.warning(`Cleanup warning: ${cleanupError.message}`);
      }
    }
  }

  // Exit with appropriate code
  process.exit(success ? 0 : 1);
}

// Handle script interruption gracefully
process.on('SIGINT', () => {
  console.log();
  log.warning('Test interrupted by user');
  process.exit(1);
});

process.on('SIGTERM', () => {
  console.log();
  log.warning('Test terminated');
  process.exit(1);
});

// Run the test
testHandshake().catch((error) => {
  log.error(`Unexpected script error: ${error.message}`);
  process.exit(1);
});

<body>
  <div class="container">
    <div class="header">
      <h1>üéõÔ∏è Launch Control XL 3</h1>
      <p>Browser Handshake Test - Web MIDI API</p>
    </div>

    <div class="requirements">
      <h3>üìã Requirements & Setup</h3>
      <ul>
        <li><strong>Browser:</strong> Chrome, Edge, or any Chromium-based browser with Web MIDI API support</li>
        <li><strong>HTTPS:</strong> This page must be served over HTTPS or localhost for Web MIDI to work</li>

        <li><strong>SysEx:</strong> When prompted, allow SysEx (System Exclusive) messages for full functionality</li>

      </ul>
